content:
Diagnosis:

Cholangiocarcinoma with widespread metastatic disease

Disease Background:
Initially diagnosed January 2024 with intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma. IDH1 wild-type on molecular testing. Multiple liver metastases and bone metastases at presentation.

Treatment History:
Cycle 1-3 Cisplatin/Gemcitabine completed March 2024
Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebra March 2024
Cycle 4 chemotherapy omitted due to clinical deterioration

Current Situation:
Significant clinical deterioration over past 3 weeks

Symptom Assessment:
Worsening right upper quadrant pain requiring increased opiate doses
New onset confusion and drowsiness
Progressive fatigue limiting mobility
Poor oral intake with 4kg weight loss in 2 weeks

Clinical Findings:
Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 3
Jaundiced with tender hepatomegaly
Mild asterixis noted
Confused with fluctuating consciousness

Recent Investigations:
CT 15 April 2024 shows marked progression of liver disease with new biliary obstruction
Bilirubin 250, ALT 456, ALP 789

Discussion with [redacted name] and family:
I had a lengthy discussion with [redacted name] and her daughter today regarding the significant deterioration in her condition. We discussed that her cancer is unfortunately progressing despite initial chemotherapy, with new complications including biliary obstruction and possible early hepatic encephalopathy. Given her current performance status, further chemotherapy would carry significant risks and is unlikely to provide benefit.

Plan:
Referral to palliative care team for urgent review
Discussion with hepatobiliary team regarding potential for biliary stenting
Increase in opiate doses with careful monitoring
Provided emergency contact numbers to family
Follow up with palliative care team next week
Outpatient review in 2 weeks or earlier if needed
